result.execSummary:
The defendant Levandior Cortez Conn Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay a fine of $30 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 6-1-16 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
Huber for work.

Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 6-1-16 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Concurrent with: with Count 1. Huber for work and 4 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levandior Cortez Conn Sr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Zachary A Wittchow for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work and 4 days credit; pay a fine of $30 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 6-1-16  if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - concurrent with Count 1 - with Huber for work and 4 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 6-1-16  if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Justice Point report dated 1-5-16 received and filed./ds

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY  to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Because incarceration is a possibility, the defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence on the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report dated 12-3-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for Megan Marie Williamson for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Hackbart needs time to review discovery with the defendant and moves for an adjournment.  

  Plea hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report dated 11-2-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense newly appointed, and awaiting discovery.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court.  Zachary A Wittchow for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Public defender has not appointed counsel as of yet.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  

  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point received and filed./ds

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Court advises the defendant he is allowed two appointments by the Public Defender's Office.  If motion is granted, this will be his second and final appointment.  Defendant states he understands.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Williamson to withdraw as counsel of record subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Justce Point report dated 9-23-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court.  Attorney Chelsea Williamson appears TELEPHONICALLY.  
Zachary A Wittchow for Megan WIlliamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing on today.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense counsel unavailable due to air flight issue(counsel not in WI).  Defense counsel available later today; the state is not.  JusticePoint miss addressed with the defendant; no action taken.  Court selects adjourned date with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Violation report received and filed - 8-19-15 - missed telephone contact./ds
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.
Defense counsel informs the court that her client would like for her to withdraw.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Court denies motion to withdraw, and orders defendant to work with counsel.  Attorney Williamson has previously mailed all discovery to defendant in which he states he has not received, and will give him a copy personally when they meet tomorrow and go over all discovery in person.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to continue with Justice Point, and to stay clean.   Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date. aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant Levandior Cortez Conn not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin Megan Williamson.
Defendant was arrested yesterday.  Defense counsel has received additional discovery and an offer today.  Case adjourned for scheduling conferce on 6/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State to provide defense with discovery related to this case and will provide an offer before next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/1/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Court ordered defendant to stay clean and not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to the defendant being previously convicted in Milwaukee County case #13CM3920 is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Sworn for the state:Matthew Vandrisse-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  This case is reassigned to Branch 03, Judge Fiorenza due to the charges in this case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
